ygData.messageBody:
Well, this is sort of a mini-rant / praise for verant.. On one hand, verant let
the pottery/brewing problem go on for FAR to long. One day would have been enough
to fix it.. Then on the other hand, I got on this morning to crys of anguish..
Was MUSIC to my smithing ears.. "WTF my pottery/brewing dosen't make money
anymore" "Why can't I sell mindless amounts of x-product back the merchant for a
huge profit" I was rolling in my chair laughing at these people.. some stuck
with tons of brewing materials that will net them nothing. Well, That is only a
childish reaction from me, for that I guess I should be sorry.. But Verant still
needs to FIX the trade skills. I don't care if your a smith, brewer, fletcher..
All the trade skills are broken. Only Jewelry is even close to being useful.
But it to will go the way of the banded armor, once the market is flooded with
items that can't break, and will pretty much never get lost. I mean right now
the only way to lose a single item is to have your coprse disappear.. That dosent
have very often once people get past 6th level.. and how hard is that.. Insted
of whining about smithing prices, or what not.. We should be on Verants ASS to
fix the trade skills. I mean come on, you can't tell me that smithing as a trade
should or was ever thought to be nothing more then making banded armor? (No I'm
NOT the kind of person to make a petition..... But one of you save the whale
types should.. (Oh I can hear the flames for that one already)) Snicker..

Draxle (not very PC) Ironworks.

Libertn2@... wrote:

> From: Libertn2@...
>
> The problem with smithing and diminishing prices is the fact that once an
> item is created, it usually never leaves circulation. Most, if not all
> banded is passed down and sold to others when it no longer has a use. What
> this means is that eventually, there will be little to no market for banded
> AT ALL. What smiths and other crafters need is some sort of item degrade.
> This is the only way to keep the trade skills working indefinitely and the
> only way to remove items from circulation.
>
> Also, another major problem with trade skills and the economy as a whole is
> the fact that Verant said they would not allow for you to sell back to a
> merchant at a profit, then went ahead and did it anyway. I was one very few
> people that was a Master at Brewing and Pottery before "The Patch." Now
> everyone and their mother is a brewer and a potter simply for the exploit.
> Can you imagine what would have happened if this was true for smiths and
> jewelers??
>
> Verant needs to stick to its word about no profit from selling to merchants.
> Already, no one sells good items any more for plat because plat is worthless.
> The current economy just leads to more camping and kill stealing.
>
> Hawkwin of Hawkwin's Roaming Emporium
